data.title: Anthony Quinn Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Anthony Quinn with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Parents both fought with Mexican revolutionary Pancho Villa

After his father died, began supporting his family at 11, working a number of different jobs, including butcher, preacher, boxer and taxi driver

While in high school, won a contest to study architecture with Frank Lloyd Wright, who sent Quinn to acting school in order to improve his speech

Launched his film career with small roles in several 1936 movies, including the crime dramas Parole! and Sworn Enemy

Best known for his role as Alexis Zorba in the 1964 feature Zorba the Greek

Painted and sculpted since childhood, but did not begin selling his pieces until the 1980s

Penned two autobiographies, The Original Sin and One Man Tango

Awards

1997Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television: nominated

1988Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Special: nominated

1970Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy: nominated

1966BAFTA Film Awards-Best Foreign Actor: nominated

1965Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama: nominated

1964Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: nominated

1964National Board of Review-Best Actor: winner

1963BAFTA Film Awards-Best Foreign Actor: nominated

1957Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: nominated

1957Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture: nominated

1956Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role: winner

1952Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role: winner
